intro: Danais thouarsii, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a striking tropical plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. Danais thouarsii is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the unique biodiversity of Madagascar.
